intro: Buchnera cruciata var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf cruciata, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and have a distinctive, slightly zigzagged margin. It is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
